Activity: Arrive at the hospital, check emails, and review any updates on influenza protocols or EHR system changes. Check with @clinlead-1 for any new guidelines.
Review yesterday's patient assessments and lab results for influenza. Note any trends or patterns that might require further investigation.
Begin patient rounds. Prioritize patients with respiratory symptoms or those who are considered high-risk. Focus on accurate symptom assessment and EHR documentation.
Assess Patient 4 (Mr. Williams) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR using the standardized tool.
Assess Patient 5 (Ms. Garcia) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR using the standardized tool.
If influenza testing is needed, collect samples and ensure proper labeling and delivery to the lab.
Continue patient rounds and accurate EHR documentation.
Lunch break. Catch up on some social media, maybe look at some cat videos.
Resume patient rounds and influenza symptom assessment, focusing on high-risk patients.
Assess Patient 6 (Mrs. Chen) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR.
Review Patient 4's (Mr. Williams) EHR entry for completeness and accuracy.
Review Patient 5's (Ms. Garcia) EHR entry for completeness and accuracy.
Follow up on lab results and document accurately in the EHR.
If any discrepancies are found in the EHR data, email @mrs-1 and @mrs-2 to request assistance in correcting the errors. Topic: EHR Data Correction Request
Prepare for shift change and communicate relevant patient information to the incoming nurse.
Final documentation and EHR review before leaving for the day.
